did.physloc: Portions of the collection are stored offsite; two days notice required for retrieval.
did.abstract: University of Michigan law professor and dean of the law school, member of numerous governmental and professional organizations; organizational and subject files.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was received in different accessions between 1970 and 1972. The collection came from two sources: from the Law School of the University of Michigan, donor no. 343 and from the family of E. Blythe Stason, donor no. 5269

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., E. Blythe Stason Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: E. Blythe Stason, dean of the Law School of the University of Michigan from 1939 to 1960, was a distinguished legal educator who also served on numerous state and national professional organizations and committees.

Born in Sioux City, Iowa in 1891, Stason graduated from the University of Wisconsin (A.B. 1913), from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (B.S. 1916), and from the University of Michigan Law School (J.D. 1922). With practical experience in both engineering and the practice of law, Stason joined the U-M Law School faculty in 1924 where he remained until his retirement on September 5, 1960. Within the University, in addition to his tenure as dean, Stason also served as Provost from 1938 to 1944.

Outside of his University responsibilities, Stason was frequently called upon for service to various governmental agencies and professional groups. He was a member of the National Conference of Commissioners on Uniform State Laws; the Michigan Constitution Revision Commission; the Michigan Tax Study Commission; the Michigan Anti-Subversive Study Committee; the Attorney General's Committee on Administrative Procedure; the Hoover Commission Task Force on Legal Services and Practices of the Executive Branch; and the Fund for Peaceful Atomic Development (Administrator beginning in 1955).

Following his retirement from the University, Stason accepted a position as administrator of the American Bar Foundation serving from 1960 to 1964. He then accepted a position at the Vanderbilt University Law School where he taught from 1964 to 1970. He died April 10, 1972.

arrangement.p: Because of his numerous and varied career activities, the Stason papers consisted of a large number of different groupings of files. For ease of access, these files have been grouped together into broadly defined categories or series corresponding mainly to similar kinds of professional activities. These series are Organizations and Activities concerned with Atomic Energy, Various state and national activities and interests, and EBS Personal

scopecontent.p: The E. Blythe Stason collection documents the activities of this law school dean, foundation head, and member of numerous governmental and professional organizations. Although there are significant materials relating to his tenure as Dean of the U-M Law School, the researcher should note that the bulk of those files will be located within the record group for that university unit.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Law.
Lawyers--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
controlaccess.corpname: National Conference of Commissioners on Uniform State Laws.
controlaccess.subject: Nuclear energy--Law and legislation.
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Commission on Organization of the Executive Branch of the Government (1953-1955)

did.unittitle: Organizations and Activities concerned with atomic energy

scopecontent.p: Files pertaining to Stason's long-held interest in peaceful uses of Atomic Energy and in the legal issues associated with atomic energy have been grouped together. Subseries within this series include: Fund for Peaceful Uses of Atomic Energy, the Michigan Memorial Phoenix Project, Atomic Energy Research Center/Atomic Energy Research Project (U-M Law School), Atomic Energy Study Commission of Michigan, and Atomic Energy Research and Subject File.

did.unittitle: Board of Directors; Executive Committee; Meetings of Members 1954-1971
Board of Directors; Executive Committee; Advisory Council (mainly correspondence) 1955-1958
Personnel suggestions for staff and missions 1956
Patent matters under the Atomic Energy Act
Atomic Energy Research Center/Atomic Energy Research Project (U-M Law School) 1955-1960
Atomic Energy Study Commission of Michigan
Atomic energy research and subject file
Atomic energy-Insurance problems of nuclear enterprise
Various state and national professional activities

scopecontent.p: The series - Various State And National Professional Activities - include subseries of material for the National Conference of Commissioners on Uniform State Laws, the American Bar Association, the State Bar of Michigan, miscellaneous Michigan Activities, miscellaneous Federal Government Activities, and the Hoover Commission Task Force on Legal Services and Procedures.

scopecontent.p: The subseries within the Personal series include a Topical File of miscellaneous subjects, Conferences attended, Articles and Speeches, and Correspondence (mainly from the period following his retirement from the Law School in 1960).
